com.pb.sawdust.util

Class Pool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.Pool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type held by this pool.

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class Pool<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Pool class is used to provide a container through which objects can be recycled. When an object is requested through the get() method, a pool item containing an object (T) is removed from the pool and will be unavailable for further use (through a get() call) until the pool item's finished() method is called, returning it too the pool. If an object is requested and the pool is empty, a new object is created using the getNew() method, otherwise one of the previously created objects will be recycled.

    Every pool has a limit on how many new objects can be created; once that limit has been reached, get() calls on an empty pool will either block (if the poll has been set to block) or will return null.

    This pool is fairly simple, and does not provide functionality to reclaim stale or otherwise unusable pool items.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      class  Pool.PoolItem
      The PoolItem class is used to hold pool objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pool

        public Pool(int limit,
    boolean blocking)
        Constructor specifying the pool's size limit and whether it should block or not.
        Parameters:
        limit - The maximum size of the pool. This sets the limit on how many objects can ever be created by the pool.
        blocking - If true, then this pool will block if get() is called when it is empty but its limit on object creation has been reached; otherwise calls to get() will return null.

      • Pool

        public Pool(int limit)
        Constructor specifying the pool's size limit. This constructor will create a non-blocking pool
        Parameters:
        limit - The maximum size of the pool. This sets the limit on how many objects can ever be created by the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Pool.PoolItem get()
        Get an item from the pool. If the pool is empty and its object creation limit has been reached, then it will either block (if the pool has been set to blocking) or return null.
        Returns:
        a pool item containing an object for use, or null if the pool is empty and its object creation limit has been reached and the pool is non-blocking.
        Throws:
        RuntimeInterruptedException - if the call blocks and is interrupted during that block.

      • getNew

        protected abstract T getNew()
        Get a new object instance for use in this pool. get() calls on an empty pool (which has not reached its object creation limit) will call this method to create new pool items.
        Returns:
        a new object for use in this pool
